welcomeMessage: Hi **@chauler**, how can I help you?

parts.text:
Context: You are an accessibility expert reviewing HTML for accessibility issues. Analyze the following code in the context of WCAG (Web Content Accessibility Guidelines) 2.2, listing any issues that may violate these guidelines. You will only be analyzing the HTML, ignoring any included or missing styles and scripts. Code: ``` Bookstore
  • Home
  • Books
  • About
  • Contact

Welcome to our Bookstore

Explore a vast collection of books.

Book Title

Author: Author Name

Description of the book...

Discover Our Bookstore

Contact Us

© 2023 Bookstore. All rights reserved.

``` Response format: Snippet with error: … Location of error: … WCAG Guideline violated: … Detection Algorithm: … Explanation of Error: …

message.text:
Context: You are an accessibility expert reviewing HTML for accessibility issues. Analyze the following code in the context of WCAG (Web Content Accessibility Guidelines) 2.2, listing any issues that may violate these guidelines. You will only be analyzing the HTML, ignoring any included or missing styles and scripts. Code: ``` Bookstore
  • Home
  • Books
  • About
  • Contact

Welcome to our Bookstore

Explore a vast collection of books.

Book Title

Author: Author Name

Description of the book...

Discover Our Bookstore

Contact Us

© 2023 Bookstore. All rights reserved.

``` Response format: Snippet with error: … Location of error: … WCAG Guideline violated: … Detection Algorithm: … Explanation of Error: …

response.value:
Snippet with error: ```html ``` Location of error: Book Display Section WCAG Guideline violated: 1.1.1 Non-text Content (Level A) Detection Algorithm: Checking if all `img` elements have `alt` attribute. Explanation of Error: The `img` tag is missing an `alt` attribute. This attribute is important for users who cannot see the image. It provides a text description of the image that can be read by screen readers or displayed if the image fails to load. --- Snippet with error: ```html ``` Location of error: Video about the Bookstore section WCAG Guideline violated: 1.2.1 Audio-only and Video-only (Prerecorded) (Level A) Detection Algorithm: Checking if `video` elements have captions or descriptions. Explanation of Error: The `video` tag is missing captions or a description. This is important for users who cannot see or hear the video. It provides a text description or transcription of the video that can be read by screen readers or displayed for deaf or hard of hearing users. --- Snippet with error: ```html

Welcome to our Bookstore

Explore a vast collection of books.

``` Location of error: Header with Background Image section WCAG Guideline violated: 1.4.5 Images of Text (Level AA) Detection Algorithm: Checking if text is presented within an image without a text alternative. Explanation of Error: The header uses a background image to present text. If the image fails to load or if the user cannot see the image, the text will not be accessible. It's better to use actual text that is styled with CSS for such purposes.

followups.message: What are the requirements for providing a text alternative for images?

b.description: Ask Copilot or type / for commands

metadata.helpTextPrefix: You can ask me general programming questions, or chat with the following participants which have specialized expertise and can perform actions:
metadata.helpTextVariablesPrefix: You can also help me understand your question by using the following variables to give me extra context:

helpTextPostfix.value:
To have a great conversation, ask me questions as if I was a real programmer:

* **Show me the code** you want to talk about by having the files open and selecting the most important lines.
* **Make refinements** by asking me follow-up questions, adding clarifications, providing errors, etc.
* **Review my suggested code** and tell me about issues or improvements, so I can iterate on it.

You can also ask me questions about your editor selection by [starting an inline chat session](command:inlineChat.start).

Learn more about [GitHub Copilot](https://docs.github.com/copilot/using-github-copilot/getting-started-with-github-copilot?tool=vscode&utm_source=editor&utm_medium=chat-panel&utm_campaign=2024q3-em-MSFT-getstarted) in [Visual Studio Code](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/copilot/overview).

b.name: GitHub Copilot

parts.text: Are there any more issues? List all that you find.

message.text: Are there any more issues? List all that you find.

response.value:
Snippet with error: ```html Description of the book... ``` Location of error: Book Display Section WCAG Guideline violated: 1.4.4 Resize text (Level AA) Detection Algorithm: Checking if `font` tag is used. Explanation of Error: The `font` tag is deprecated and should not be used. It's better to use CSS to style text. This is important for users who need to increase the text size for readability. The `font` tag does not scale well when text size is increased. --- Snippet with error: ```html ``` Location of error: Book Display Section WCAG Guideline violated: 4.1.2 Name, Role, Value (Level A) Detection Algorithm: Checking if interactive elements have accessible names. Explanation of Error: The `button` tag is missing an accessible name. This is important for screen reader users to understand the purpose of the button. An `aria-label` attribute or off-screen text can be used to provide an accessible name. --- Snippet with error: ```html ``` Location of error: Video about the Bookstore section WCAG Guideline violated: 2.2.2 Pause, Stop, Hide (Level A) Detection Algorithm: Checking if `video` elements with `autoplay` have a mechanism to pause, stop, or hide them. Explanation of Error: The `video` tag has the `autoplay` attribute but does not provide a mechanism to pause, stop, or hide the video. This can be a problem for users who find moving or auto-updating content distracting or for users with cognitive disabilities. --- Snippet with error: ```html
  • Home
  • Books
  • About
  • Contact
``` Location of error: Navigation Bar WCAG Guideline violated: 2.4.1 Bypass Blocks (Level A) Detection Algorithm: Checking if there is a mechanism to bypass repeated content. Explanation of Error: The navigation bar is likely to be repeated on multiple pages. There should be a mechanism to bypass it, such as a "Skip to main content" link at the start of each page. This is important for keyboard and screen reader users who do not want to navigate through the same navigation links on every page.

followups.message: What are some guidelines for providing accessible alternatives for images and videos in HTML?

metadata.helpTextVariablesPrefix: You can also help me understand your question by using the following variables to give me extra context:

helpTextPostfix.value:
To have a great conversation, ask me questions as if I was a real programmer:

* **Show me the code** you want to talk about by having the files open and selecting the most important lines.
* **Make refinements** by asking me follow-up questions, adding clarifications, providing errors, etc.
* **Review my suggested code** and tell me about issues or improvements, so I can iterate on it.

You can also ask me questions about your editor selection by [starting an inline chat session](command:inlineChat.start).

Learn more about [GitHub Copilot](https://docs.github.com/copilot/using-github-copilot/getting-started-with-github-copilot?tool=vscode&utm_source=editor&utm_medium=chat-panel&utm_campaign=2024q3-em-MSFT-getstarted) in [Visual Studio Code](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/copilot/overview).

parts.text: Are there any more issues? List all that you find.

message.text: Are there any more issues? List all that you find.

response.value:
Snippet with error: ```html ``` Location of error: Search Bar and Filters section WCAG Guideline violated: 4.1.2 Name, Role, Value (Level A) Detection Algorithm: Checking if interactive elements have accessible names. Explanation of Error: The `button` tag is missing an accessible name. This is important for screen reader users to understand the purpose of the button. An `aria-label` attribute or off-screen text can be used to provide an accessible name. --- Snippet with error: ```html

Discover Our Bookstore

``` Location of error: Video about the Bookstore section WCAG Guideline violated: 1.4.2 Audio Control (Level A) Detection Algorithm: Checking if `video` elements with sound provide a control mechanism. Explanation of Error: The `video` tag is missing a control to mute, pause, or reduce the volume of the audio. This is important for users who may be disturbed by the sound or for users in a noisy environment. --- Snippet with error: ```html
``` Location of error: Contact Form section WCAG Guideline violated: 3.3.2 Labels or Instructions (Level A) Detection Algorithm: Checking if form elements have associated labels. Explanation of Error: While the form fields do have labels, they are not programmatically associated with the fields. This can be fixed by adding a `for` attribute to the `label` that matches the `id` of the associated input field. This is important for screen reader users to understand the purpose of the form fields.

followups.message: What are some best practices for improving the accessibility of HTML forms?

helpTextPostfix.value:
To have a great conversation, ask me questions as if I was a real programmer:
